Description: ATCC is committed to providing cancer models that lead to breakthroughs in therapeutic discovery and development. To this end, we are focused on developing new products that can accelerate oncology pre-clinical research and drug development. This workshop will highlight two application areas of our current focus: 2-D and 3-D models for the Human Cancer Models Initiative (HCMI) and reporter models and primary cells for immuno-oncology–based therapeutics. Join this session to learn about organoids, neurospheres, conditionally reprogrammed cells, CAR-T Target reporters for assessing effector cell potency, checkpoint inhibitor reporters, and primary CD8+ cytotoxic T cells.
SearchResultBody: ESP07D. Cell-based Models for the Discovery and Development of Cancer Therapeutics
Title: Cell-based Models for the Discovery and Development of Cancer Therapeutics
